messages.message:
Hello Team, during Signature image detection - how do we identify a signature? Do we look at just machine text or detect handwriting (i.e. signature)? For example if were to print my name instead of signing it, would IB be able to identfiy that as a signature?
Thx

we just count the pixels (unless this has changed more recently?) cc @Aaron Vontell, so yes writing your name would be detected.

I know @Badri made an actual ML model for this for metlife, not sure if itâ€™s ready for consumption though, could provide an alternative.
Hi @Faisal what use-case are you trying to solve?
The question from RBC was surround this Signed field. I can print/type in Ashley or I can sign Ashley (handwritten). Is Instabase able to tell apart between Printed text vs Handwritten text?
yes -- we can tell you handwritten vs printed
I can get you a cool demo for that

Hi Anant, I dont think a Demo is needed at this point. It was a question thrown to us by RBC team as we were doing a training for them.
Initially we were also thinking the same that we identify pixels within the marked box. For now, we can go back to RBC and let them know we can distinguish between handwritten(signed) vs. printed text
Thx!
